text: Ed, Edd, and Eddy and it’s not even CLOSE https://t.co/ZmmnHZoI3e

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: The “host” @NickLachey & @VanessaLachey are self-serving sabotogers vying for relevance by coming up with fake dating/marriage shows just to exploit people with real mental/emotional trauma while feeding them alcohol in every scene! @netflix #TheUltimatium #UltimatumNetflix

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: And they have people on this show who’s brains aren’t or barely are fully developed with alcohol in their hands in every scene! It’s reckless and negligent and needs to be stopped! They are exploiting these people! End this show #CancelTheUltimate #TheUltimatium #ultimatenetflix

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: The #UltimatumNetflix really is messy af, but we also need to talk about how Vanessa & Nick should be investigated because they are clearly casting people with substance abuse issues and fueling then with alcohol (and who knows what behind the scenes). It’s truly scary…

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: What a historical moment for black Americans to see our sister represented in the highest halls of government. This is truly a feat, but there is no better, more qualified, and well suited woman for the position other than (Justice) Ketanji Brown Jackson! #KBJ

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: If @POTUS is truly committed to racial equity and justice then he will cancel student loan debt, period.  #CancelStudentDebt

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: If @POTUS don’t just got ahead and cancel these damn student loans 🫠#CancelStudentDebt

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: Weird, I still haven’t seen a statement from @kyrstensinema (@SenatorSinema) on Judge Jackson’s confirmation. What day ye? #ConfirmJudgeJackson #KBJ

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: CYNTHIA LADIES AND GENTLEMEN

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: Jazmin truly deserves! What a goddess! @jsullivanmusic I have had your album on repeat DAILY since both version releases! I Stan! I love you! #JazmineSullivan #GRAMMYs

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: I’m drained 😞

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: This is my season. I’m claiming. I’m manifesting. I’m becoming. I am about to be.

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: There’s a difference between making fun of Oprah’s former ‘Spiritual Advisor’ running for president and a black woman who has a health condition out of her control that causes her hair to fall out, especially given the context, history, and political nature that is black hair… https://t.co/BdERnDRVbw

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: Therein lies the issue. Stop making offensive comments about people’s looks/things they cannot change and passing them off as “jokes”. Not everyone is up for or open to being joked with. If you need to rely on offensive humor to be funny then choose another profession ASAP https://t.co/VvMimOSIAi

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: THIS. LITERALLY THIS. https://t.co/oK6oLk7Qhc

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: And let also say, there won’t be any interviews with any major networks or journalist. This family is known for keeping their business and if they say anything it’ll be on their time, their platforms, and their perspectives. Have we learned nothing about the Solange/Jay-Z fiasco?

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: His digs at Jada in recent years are indicative and (in my opinion) the #Oscars way of sneak dissing after Jada led the #OscarsSoWhite boycott a few years ago. Y’all not slick. They used Chris Rock as a vessel for their shortcomings and he paid the price

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: Now, white people coming to Chris’ defense makes sense. The #Oscars knew good and damn well that they could claim and parade “diversity” by having Chris Rock up there because they find him safe, acceptable, and palatable, but knows he would have NEVER done that to a white woman

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: The #Oscars was not the place to showcase that. He could’ve abs should’ve exercised way better judgement, especially after Jada recently talking about her struggles with alopecia. Somethings are just off limits and that includes within comedy

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: But back to Chris: Aside from his repulsive joke last night, he has worked with Jada on not 1, not 2, but 3 films. Why he would come out with a joke like that was foolish and uncalled for. I don’t claim to know their entire history, but if there is underlying beef…

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: He was safe, acceptable, and palatable to largely white audiences, but so much so that his blackness seemed to be removed. Side bar: it’s been a long held topic of conversation but Chris Tucker > Chris Rock has always been true in terms of black comedians

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: After many of his earlier films, once he started to make headwinds with white audiences and transitioned into voice acting for Disney/Pixar, many of his later projects seem to shed his blackness. He could be the black funny guy, but not “too black”.

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text:
Groundbreaking in the fact that she was a black woman to be depicted in a major Sci-Fi film/show since Star Trek (Nod to Nichelle Nichols). So that is why black people feel so strongly to protect and defend them. 

Chris Rock on the other hand hasn’t been had the same impact

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: Yes, Will has ascended to A-List status in his career, however, he has always been deliberate in choosing roles that tell black stories. The same can be said about Jada. And before people say, “The Matrix isn’t reality”, I know. We know. But her appearance in that film was…

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: Black households about sex, sexuality, sexual expression, relationships, parenting, etc. Not all of it has been accepted, but (black) people can acknowledge and appreciate a new representation of black love and the black family. The are a household name like it or not.

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: I think it goes to show who has resonated more with each community. Black people hold The Smiths close because we’ve seen some of their most authentic selves while staying true to who they’ve been. The Smiths have undoubtedly spurred  countless conversations within…

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: The same kind when your father can brag about assaulting women and then go on to be president and then lie about losing his re-election and stage an insurrection where multiple people die as a result of and still not be in jail. That kind. https://t.co/cjHXmKaBBV

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: The Oscars is a place to uplift, showcase, and celebrate the films, sounds, lighting, etc. of Hollywood, but it is not a Comedy Roast. Save that for Comedy Central or MTV2. Chris’ just was unwarranted and unnecessary, period.

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: Comedy has always inherently provocative, but we must admit over the years it’s become flat out offensive and not everyone is rocking with that. “For every action there is an equal and opposite reaction”. N3L. We saw that in a human example

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: Seeing a lot of comedians saying “what if I’m next?” And I agree. Looks like it’s time to change your ill-informed, low blow jokes and write material that can be funny w/o insulting.

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: People thinking Will Smith is losing his career over this are delusional. A black and slapped another black man. A white producer/studio is NOT going to reject getting a bag by working with Will in the future. https://t.co/yuq7F2D8mH

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: I agree. But #WillSmith has endured so much slander about his wife and kids over the year and has done the “right thing”. Maybe let’s shift our perspective to the jokes. Words are violence, too. The pained look on Jada’s face let me know that was triggering to her. https://t.co/WkiVQwaGCI

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: And definitely not conservatives talking about #ToxicMasculinity and assault when men (and women) literally scaled the capitol building to beat and violently assault any elected official they could find, including the then VP, to overturn a free and fair election

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: Seeing lots of tweets about #WillSmith not hitting August and it’s not only stupid, but very kink shame-y/sex negative. If that was their thing at the time that’s between them, but just because a man is open enough to allow his partner to be with other ppl doesn’t make him weak

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: For all the “he ruined his Oscar”, “toxic masculinity”, “this is assault” do-gooders, please get over yourself. If it’s not something you would’ve done then say that but please don’t police how someone else to express and show their protection for their partner #WillSmith

author: AllBlackLivesMatter
text: HOLY SMOKES WILL SMITH
